subject: ffdc: Integrate ffdc script into robot framework flow.
commitMessage:
ffdc: Integrate ffdc script into robot framework flow.

This commit provides interface to enable automation tests (robot/jenkins)
to activate the new cli ffdc collector.

- Patchset 1: Initial commit for review.
- Patchset 2: Redesing and fixing issues
- Patchset 3: Fix build issue (pycodestyle)
- Patchset 4: Default ffdc store location running direct CLI
- Patchset 5: Addressing review comments and questions
- Patchset 6: Restore direct CLI default location to /tmp
- Patchset 7: Addressing issues from comments
              Also extend socket timeout for long-running command peltool -a
- Patchset 8: Use Builtin().log_to_console("") method in the bridge code
- Patchset 9: Rebase

Tests:
- Standalone script: python3 ./ffdc/collect_ffdc.py
- Within robot env: python3 -m robot .... -v FFDC_DEFAULT:0 ./tools/myffdc.robot

Signed-off-by: Peter D  Phan <peterp@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ic892c48efe7dbdb3a4345ba89c3a0257f03a7ffb

Can you please highlight the changes done in this commit?
Better to name this as this_ffdc so that all variables are in snake case.
Any particular reason why this is changed to a class method?
Yes! When this ffdc utility is invoked from robot, we need to verify that we can access/create ffdc storage location *prior* to instantiate the object. We use class method to do the verification.
Please document the purpose of this script
Please specify the keys for which dictionary. I know it is for the kwargs mentioned below but pls document that.
Can you pls document what these parameters are for?
Please provide a description for this with an example. Also the purpose. Will this collect the FFDC for the given server? Elaborating on that will help.
Pls document the method's functionality and describe the arguments.
Include these default values when describing the arguments for the method
Can you document what this variable signifies and what it does when set to 1 and also how to set it?

Add a comment like this
# Python module:  get_version_tar(tar_file_path)

Leave it in since it is different from the Test Case Document

eg: # Python module:  get_version_tar(tar_file_path)
